position.marginalia_text: È viuo fonte Natura[e], artis, exercitationis efficacissima[e].

marginalia.translation: From the living source of nature, art, and the most effective practice.
There is no distinguished virtue, unless it is compelled.

position.marginalia_text: Quisq[ue] sui compos, fert benè quodq[ue] malu[m]. Axiophilus.

marginalia.translation: Whoever is the master of himself suffers well any virtue. Axiophilus.

position.marginalia_text: Simplices sunt Academici, qui potiùs ambiunt
esse uerbosi philologi, polyhistores, Critici, quàm actuosi technologi, philosophi, professores.

marginalia.translation: Academics are simple people, who would rather go about being verbose philologists, polyhistors, and critics, rather than energetic technologi, philosophers, and professors.

position.marginalia_text: Promptissimè singula et dicere, et facere, et perficere, ingeniosum est et quiddam diuinum. Quò etiam dexteriùs, suaq[ue] sponte fluentiùs, eò ca[e]lestius, et quasi è Natura[e] sinu. Balbutire autem in loquendo, aut in agendo deficere
aliquo modo: vel infantis est, uel hominis planè rudis.

marginalia.translation: Saying, doing, and accomplishing singular things most promptly is an ingenious thing and even divine. And the more skillfully and fluently of its own accord, the more celestial it is, as if coming from the bosom of nature. But to babble in speaking, or to fail in acting in any way, is either the work of a child or of a wholly uncivilized man.

position.marginalia_text: [p. 209: Nihil valent litera[e], quatenùs scholastica[e], sed quatenùs mundana[e]: nec discuntur artes. Vt sciantur, sed vt prosint. Earumq[ue] prima, et summa Qua[e]stio, =] = Quia possunt? quantum valent. Cui priuata[e], aut publica[e] facultati conducunt? Iam enim Artes aut in Commoditatum numero reponuntur; aut in nullo sunt

marginalia.translation: [p. 209: No literature will prevail as long as it is scholastic, but only as long as it worldly: nor will the arts be learned. In order that they could be known, but also so that they could be useful. The first of these and highest question,] because the can? How much they are worth. For whom private and public faculties are of advantage? For already the arts are either restored in a number of utilities, or they are in none.
